intro: Franseria bipinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved franseria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are deeply lobed and pinnatifid. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small umbels, and bloom during the cooler months. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in open woodlands and along riverbanks.
